#### Live-
action[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Black_Panther_\(comics\)&action=edit&section=44
"Edit section: Live-action")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/bd/Chadwick_Boseman_as_Black_Panther_in_Captain_America_Civil_War.jpg/170px-
Chadwick_Boseman_as_Black_Panther_in_Captain_America_Civil_War.jpg)](/wiki/File:Chadwick_Boseman_as_Black_Panther_in_Captain_America_Civil_War.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Chadwick_Boseman_as_Black_Panther_in_Captain_America_Civil_War.jpg
"Enlarge")

[Chadwick Boseman](/wiki/Chadwick_Boseman "Chadwick Boseman") as Black Panther
in _[Captain America: Civil War](/wiki/Captain_America:_Civil_War "Captain
America: Civil War")_.

[Chadwick Boseman](/wiki/Chadwick_Boseman "Chadwick Boseman") portrays
T'Challa within the [Marvel Cinematic
Universe](/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe "Marvel Cinematic Universe"), first
appearing in _[Captain America: Civil War](/wiki/Captain_America:_Civil_War
"Captain America: Civil War")_ (2016).[167][168] In the film, he is shown
displaying enhanced speed, agility, strength, and durability, which he gains
from ingesting the heart-shaped herb, as in the comics.[169] His suit has
retractable claws and is made of a vibranium weave, which can deflect heavy
machine gun fire. As of [the 2018 film _Black
Panther_](/wiki/Black_Panther_\(film\) "Black Panther \(film\)"), he wears a
new variant of the suit that can absorb kinetic energy (represented as purple
highlights) and release it as a purple shockwave after enough has been
amassed. It can also fold into a silver necklace.

  * During the events of _Civil War_ , motivated by revenge for his father's death during the UN signing of the Sokovian Accords in the aftermath of _[Avengers: Age of Ultron](/wiki/Avengers:_Age_of_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron")_ , T'Challa joins Iron Man's faction to oppose Captain America as he is protecting the Winter Soldier who was implicated for the attack. But T'Challa learns the bombing attack was actually arranged by Helmut Zemo to orchestrate his own revenge on the Avengers for inadvertently creating the [Sokovia crisis](/wiki/Avengers:_Age_of_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron") which killed his family. After hearing Zemo's confession as he succeeded in turning Stark and Rogers against each other, T'Challa renounces his revenge while preventing Zemo's suicide and handing him over to [Everett K. Ross](/wiki/Everett_K._Ross "Everett K. Ross"). T'Challa grants Rogers and Barnes sanctuary in Wakanda while also aiding in the latter's recovery from his [Hydra](/wiki/Hydra_\(comics\) "Hydra \(comics\)") brainwashing.
  * Boseman reprises the role in _[Black Panther](/wiki/Black_Panther_\(film\) "Black Panther \(film\)")_ (2018).[167][168] By October 2015, Joe Robert Cole was in final negotiations to write the film's script.[170] In January 2016, it was announced that [Ryan Coogler](/wiki/Ryan_Coogler "Ryan Coogler") had been hired to direct the film,[171] and was later revealed to be co-writing the script with Cole.[172] Filming began in January 2017 at Pinewood Studios in Atlanta, Georgia.[173] The film was released on February 16, 2018.[174] During the film's storyline, after completing the ritual of succession, T'Challa finds himself dealing with opposition to his new position from various fronts.
  * Boseman appears as Black Panther again in _[Avengers: Infinity War](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War "Avengers: Infinity War")_ (2018).[175] In the film, T'Challa, [Steve Rogers](/wiki/Captain_America "Captain America"), [Bucky](/wiki/Bucky_Barnes "Bucky Barnes"), and the rest of the Avengers try to defend [Wakanda](/wiki/Wakanda_\(comics\) "Wakanda \(comics\)") from the oncoming onslaught of [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos "Thanos"), who seeks to claim all the [Infinity Stones](/wiki/Infinity_Gems "Infinity Gems") to destroy half of the sentient universe. When his plan succeeds, many of Earth's citizens and the Avengers start to disintegrate, with T'Challa being among them.

####
Animation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Black_Panther_\(comics\)&action=edit&section=45
"Edit section: Animation")]

  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther appears in the direct-to-DVD animated feature _[Ultimate Avengers 2](/wiki/Ultimate_Avengers_2 "Ultimate Avengers 2")_ (2006) as a central character, voiced by [Jeffrey D. Sams](/wiki/Jeffrey_D._Sams "Jeffrey D. Sams").
  * In the direct-to-DVD film, _[Next Avengers: Heroes of Tomorrow](/wiki/Next_Avengers:_Heroes_of_Tomorrow "Next Avengers: Heroes of Tomorrow")_ , T'Challa has a son with Storm named Azari. Black Panther was called one last time to fight with the Avengers against the robot Ultron....but Black Panther did not survive. It is unknown what happened to Storm, for after the Battle with Ultron, Tony Stark (Iron Man) raised Azari along with the children of the fallen members of the Avengers.[176]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther appears in the 2014 animated [motion comic](/wiki/Motion_comic "Motion comic") movie _Marvel Knights: Wolverine vs. Sabretooth_. When Wolverine winds up in Africa, Black Panther and Storm assist him.[177]
  * On October 9, 2017, _Black Panther: Trouble in Wakanda_ was announced.[178]

####
Web[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Black_Panther_\(comics\)&action=edit&section=46
"Edit section: Web")]

In 2016, [Disney XD](/wiki/Disney_XD "Disney XD") launched on its
[YouTube](/wiki/YouTube "YouTube") channel the motion comic "Black Panther in
... The Visitor".[179]

### Video
games[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Black_Panther_\(comics\)&action=edit&section=47
"Edit section: Video games")]

  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _[Marvel: Ultimate Alliance](/wiki/Marvel:_Ultimate_Alliance "Marvel: Ultimate Alliance")_ , voiced by [Phil LaMarr](/wiki/Phil_LaMarr "Phil LaMarr"). He can be unlocked by collecting 5 of his action figures. When the player asks about how Black Panther came to be, he will bring up his history which involved his father being killed by Klaw and passing every trial to become the next Black Panther. He has special dialogue with Nick Fury, Namor, Ghost Rider, Doctor Doom, and Deathbird. In his simulation disc, he has to battle Dark Captain America in Arcade's Murderworld.[180]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is an [NPC](/wiki/Non-player_character "Non-player character") in _[Marvel: Ultimate Alliance 2](/wiki/Marvel:_Ultimate_Alliance_2 "Marvel: Ultimate Alliance 2")_ , voiced by [Tim Russ](/wiki/Tim_Russ "Tim Russ").[181] He is one of the few characters in the game to not be taken under the control of The Fold, providing the heroes with a base prior to the final assault on the Fold as Wakanda is now the last bastion of resistance against the nanites. He is playable in Vicarious Visions (Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3, later also PlayStation 4, Xbox One and PC) versions and originally as a downloadable character for PS3 and Xbox 360.[182]
  * Black Panther appears as an NPC in Storm's ending for _[Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds](/wiki/Marvel_vs._Capcom_3:_Fate_of_Two_Worlds "Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds")_.
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _[Marvel Super Hero Squad Online](/wiki/Marvel_Super_Hero_Squad_Online "Marvel Super Hero Squad Online")_.
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in the [Facebook](/wiki/Facebook "Facebook") game _[Marvel: Avengers Alliance](/wiki/Marvel:_Avengers_Alliance "Marvel: Avengers Alliance")_.
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in the [MMORPG](/wiki/MMORPG "MMORPG") _[Marvel Heroes](/wiki/Marvel_Heroes_\(video_game\) "Marvel Heroes \(video game\)")_ ,[183] voiced by James C. Mathis III.
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther appears as a playable character in _[Lego Marvel Super Heroes](/wiki/Lego_Marvel_Super_Heroes "Lego Marvel Super Heroes")_ , voiced by John Eric Bentley. He is also shown to have a pet cat named Mr. Tiddles. In the mid-credits, Nick Fury encounters him while overseeing the reconstruction of the Statue of Liberty. After finding Mr. Tiddles, Black Panther tells Nick Fury that the people of Wakanda thank him for thwarting Galactus' attack.
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _Marvel Avengers Alliance Tactics_.
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _[Marvel Contest of Champions](/wiki/Marvel_Contest_of_Champions "Marvel Contest of Champions")_.[184]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _Marvel Mighty Heroes_.[185]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _[Marvel Future Fight](/wiki/Marvel_Future_Fight "Marvel Future Fight")_.[186]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther is a playable character in _[Disney Infinity 3.0](/wiki/Disney_Infinity_3.0 "Disney Infinity 3.0")_.[187]
  * The MCU version of Black Panther is a playable character in _[Lego Marvel's Avengers](/wiki/Lego_Marvel%27s_Avengers "Lego Marvel's Avengers")_.[188] He is a [DLC](/wiki/Downloadable_content "Downloadable content") Character available in the "Civil War" pack. His pet cat Mr. Tiddles from _Lego Marvel Super Heroes_ also reappears in the hub areas of the game. A DLC pack based on Classic Black Panther was later released for the game. Classic Black Panther appears as the main playable character of the pack along with several other supporting characters and villains and his Skybike.[189]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther appears as a playable character in _[Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2](/wiki/Lego_Marvel_Super_Heroes_2 "Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2")_.[190]
  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther appears as a [downloadable](/wiki/Downloadable_content "Downloadable content") character in _[Marvel vs. Capcom: Infinite](/wiki/Marvel_vs._Capcom:_Infinite "Marvel vs. Capcom: Infinite")_ , with James C. Mathis III reprising his role.[191] In the story, he rules the kingdom of Valkanda, using the [Time Stone](/wiki/Infinity_Gems "Infinity Gems") to protect it. When the heroes appear and help defend the kingdom from invaders, he offers them the Time Stone to aid their quest.
  * Black Panther appears as a playable character in _[Marvel Strike Force](/wiki/Marvel_Strike_Force "Marvel Strike Force")_.[192]

### Role-playing
games[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Black_Panther_\(comics\)&action=edit&section=48
"Edit section: Role-playing games")]

  * The T'Challa iteration of Black Panther appears in the 1984 role-playing game based on Marvel characters, _[Marvel Super Heroes](/wiki/Marvel_Super_Heroes_\(role-playing_game\) "Marvel Super Heroes \(role-playing game\)")_. He also appears in all subsequent updates and versions.[193]
